item.title: Is Breaking Bad an example of Orange turning Red?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

I would say it's Blue/Orange going into Orange but in a neurotic, unhealthy way. Maybe it devolves into Red too.

The whole show is basically about Walter gaining his independence from society and personal power (which is Blue --> Orange), just in an unhealthy way.

It reminds me of the standard PUA arch: lame anti-social guy learns to pick up girls and devolves into a manwhore, corrupted by excessive ego and power.

item.title: Is black mold in water damaged buildings a threat to consciousness?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Black mold is very unhealthy and it will screw up your health and your ability to do consciousness work.

It's very difficult to self-actualize when you are unhealthy, so fix all your health issues ASAP.

item.title: self inquiry work
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Nevon No one can tell you what you are. The whole point of self-inquiry is to discover what you are for yourself.

Keep digging deeper and avoid asking others to tell you what are. That is a big trap in this work. The answer cannot be given to you. If it could, I would have already done so and you would already be enlightened. But it does not work that way. No one can enlighten you.

item.title: Does Leo ever speak of "spirit guides" "angels" & "dark entities"
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, Sippycup said:

@Leo Gura is it not the focus because you don't believe it's helpful? I didn't think so either until I was thrust into it

It can be very helpful, but also a potential trap.

Some people are much more paranormally attuned than others. Genetic factors probably play a big role. I am not one of those people.

in Self-Actualization

@SeanD Being too picky about what you like and dislike is will get you into judgemental territory very quickly.

The ego loves to whine and complain about all the stuff it doesn't like.

Surrendering opinions and desires is a good practice.

item.title: How can a person eliminating judging when one of his core strengths is Judgement?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@George Fil Don't confuse judging with the judging talked about in that survey.

They are two totally different things.

The judging you want to avoid is: condemning a thing as "bad" or "evil", which carries with it a negative emotional charge. This kind of judging wishes that the "bad" thing not exist. It's basically a crusade against evil. Which is pure ego in action.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:

11 minutes ago, Outer said:

Science is the tool for success which ultimately is the tool for anything, including Truth, any domain which has success and thus hierarchies like enlightenment.

This is false.

item.title: The threat of panpsychism: a warning
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 minutes ago, RichardY said:

@Leo Gura Can God be perfect without morality though, delusional or not? Berkeley seemed fearful of the absolute, an aberration to speak it, at the end of one his books you recommended.

Best for whom though and why?

Perfection is only possible in the absence of morality.

That's the rub, perfection is only attainable for no one. So to see it, you must become no one.

There are no whoms. There is only God.

Quote

"Out beyond ideas of right-doing and wrong-doing, there is a field. I will meet you there."

-- Rumi

Quote

"I saw my Lord with the eye of the heart
I asked, 'Who are You?'
He replied, 'You'."

-- Mansur Al-Hallaj

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Outer You might as well post some pictures of Jesus to a kid who got molested by a Catholic priest.

That is what your defense of science amounts to.

Believe it or not, it's possible to launch a rocket into space but still be utterly deluded about the nature of reality.

Success != Truth

As I've told you guys many times before.

Sadhguru could be full of shit for all you know.

Discover what is true DIRECTLY!

item.title: The threat of panpsychism: a warning
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
4 minutes ago, RichardY said:

@Leo Gura Why Leibniz and not Berkeley?

Because you quoted Leibniz, not Berkeley.

I didn't say everything Leibniz says is true. I merely said that one phrase "the best of all possible worlds" is true.

God is absolutely perfect. Leibniz understood that much.

item.title: The threat of panpsychism: a warning
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
14 minutes ago, Outer said:

So you're a panpsychist and not an idealist/nondualist and you say this is true.

Nope

That's your silly interpretation of me.

I merely told you that you can become conscious that reality is absolutely perfect. That is Nirvana. The ego drowns in infinite perfection and love.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
26 minutes ago, Outer said:

What is science getting wrong and why is it corrupt?

That is too deep a topic to address in a forum post.

I'll shoot some videos about that in the future.

As I said in my Recontextualization video, science gets the context wrong.

  • Neuroscience is wrong
  • Western medicine is wrong
  • QM interpreations are wrong
  • Reductionism is wrong
  • Materialism is wrong
  • Evolutionary theory is wrong
  • Paranormal research is being denied
  • Etc.

But if you cannot see how phrenology was part of science, then you will not understand my critiques of modern scientific problems. You must understand the past before you have a hope of understanding the present.

Unless you have studied the history of science or philosophy of science this will go over your head. These are very tricky issues that require years of careful study and contemplation.

The way you are writing it strikes me that you have not invested any time investigating what science is or how it works at the epistemic level.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Outer Bro, you need to listen more carefully. This isn't rocket science. I said my position very clearly in the video. Watch it again from the beginning with an open mind.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
12 minutes ago, Outer said:

No you didn't.

"Can a rock be conscious?"

"Or is a rock conscious?"

"A rock is not conscious, a rock is inside of consciousness"

Yes! That's what I am saying now.

"Inside of consciousness" is identical to being consciousness.

There only exists 1 thing: consciousness, period. The end. There is nothing else. This understanding is Absolute. It is true under all circumstances.

Consciousness is not a feature of brains. Consciousness is the substance of "physical" reality.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
27 minutes ago, Outer said:

What is science getting wrong and why is it corrupt?

You know science is not some high priest order, it's a tool, I use it, many people use it, it works. It's like saying magic in a role playing game is corrupt and deeply wrong. It can't be corrupt and deeply wrong because it's not a person or organisation.

So phrenology was not wrong? Newtonian mechanics was not wrong? Logical positivism was not wrong? Behaviorism was not wrong? Bloodletting with leeches was not wrong? Lobotomies were not wrong? Atomic theory was not wrong? Social Darwinism was not wrong?

Need I continue?

The errors of science are too numerous to list and explain.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 minutes ago, Outer said:

I don't think Vivec is consciousness or my computer. Or a rock. A  tree or the body or anything.

I don't think so, I absolutely AM so.

I said in my consciousness video that a rock is not conscious, but it is consciousness. Which is exactly what I am saying now.

Go do some psychedelics cause you are clearly lost in your own mind beyond help.

What I am saying isn't panpsychism, it is pure nonduality. You just lack the direct experience necessary to understand it.

item.title: Spiral dynamics model breaks down under emotional mastery
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
36 minutes ago, Sockrattes said:

I mean for example: Were dinosaurs 'invented' when we found the first skeletons?

It's much weirder than that!

Dinosaurs are a concept in your head.

You ain't never seen a dinosaur. And even if you had, unless you are looking one in the face right this second, it is a concept nonetheless.

Your own birth is a concept!

Your own head is a concept!

Oh-oh... this isn't looking too good for you...

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 minutes ago, Outer said:

So what's the powder, 5-MeO-DMT (which is a chemical structure)?

5-MeO-DMT is consciousness. Chemicals are consciousness. Everything is consciousness.

When I snort 5-MeO, I am snorting myself. In the same way that I gave birth to myself out of my own vagina, since I am EVERYTHING.

If it sounds ridiculous, that's on you. The truth is stranger than fiction. It's your job to surrender to it, not to judge it.

Or... feel free to keep acting arrogant. The truth don't care how ignorant you are.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
32 minutes ago, Outer said:

@Leo Gura You're relying on science. You are typing here, everything here is due to science. You also took LSD, which is a creation of science, and you wouldn't touch psychedelics in our culture without science telling you about safety.

Let's bash science for no reason. It's like a kid angry at their parents for offering broccoli.

That is what a Catholic says when their church is accused of molesting children: stop bashing God.

Science is being bashed for a reason: it gets a lot of stuff deeply wrong and it is corrupt.

We can criticize the theortical foundations of science without rejecting technology in the same way that we can criticize corrupt politicians without rejecting government.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
15 minutes ago, Outer said:

@Leo Gura A physical substance 5-MeO-DMT travels from the RoA in the Leo body, completely physically, to the brain, still physically. Attaching in receptors physically, eventually it runs out in the brain.

How is anything I said here untrue?

"Physical" is a concept you invented.

There ain't no such thing.

item.title: BANNED Ted Talks
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
45 minutes ago, InfinitePotential said:

he's just talking about areas where he thinks mainstream science is wrong, shouldn't that be encouraged

Lol

No! Of course not! Ego does not care about truth. Ego cares about self-preservation (illusion).

Ego does not admit mistakes because ego is perfect. Science cannot be wrong, by definition. Ego cannot be wrong by definition. Only not-science can be wrong.

Radical critiques of science are NOT okay! That is too dangerous to the collective scientific ego. Which is why science advances one dead scientist at a time, and scientific consensus is about 100 years out of date.

After you're dead, science will be a bit better

Think about this: if humans lived forever, science would stop working.

item.title: Spiral dynamics model breaks down under emotional mastery

in Self-Actualization

@CreamCat Loosely

item.title: Should I even pursue enlightenment right now?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@28 cm unbuffed Only you can know what you need or don't need.

But whatever you decide, I recommended you keep a habit of Kriya yoga, or meditation, or self-inquiry going. Even if just 30 minutes per day. That will slowly eat away at the ego and after some years your desires will naturally turn towards enlightenment.

Psychedelic trips once a month is also a great habit.

If you can't muster the courage to approach enlightenment head on, do it sideways through baby habits.

item.title: Spontaneity and Tony Parsons
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@rirdsaam Self-inquiry is necessary. Sit down and start questioning what you are.

Try to point to yourself. Where exactly are you? What exactly are you?

See Leo's Practical Guide To Enlightenment (pinned thread).

Psychedelics speed up the process x1000.

Kriya yoga also great.

item.title: Spontaneity and Tony Parsons
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Of course, that's nonduality 101.

No ego = no control

The whole point of meditation is to realize you are not in control of your thoughts. You (ego) ARE a thought!

My video: Free Will vs Determinism, is all about this.

God is in control of everything, so to speak. But then again, you are God! So it goes full-circle in a way that you will not be able to appreciate until after awakening.

item.title: Sadhguru says Psychedelics Dull the System and Yoga shouldn’t be learned from a book

item.title: Spiral dynamics model breaks down under emotional mastery
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Sockrattes At the moment it was invented

You have to understand that Spiral Dynamics did not exist 100 years ago. Electrons did not exist 300 years ago. Human rights did not exist 500 years ago. Mathematics did not exist 10,000 years ago. Etc.

All of these are conceptual schemes which cannot exist until they are invented.

For example, the notion of a subconscious mind did not exist until Sigmund Freud invented it 100 years ago.

Think about that! There was no subconscious mind before it was invented by a human! And then it appeared one day.

The ancient Greeks did not have subconscious minds! You do!

There were no electrons 300 years ago, now they exist! Ta-da!

YOU are inventing all this shit while vehemently denying that you are doing so.

You even invented the concept of your own birth. That's how you came into being! You did not exist until you thought, "I exist". And you will die as soon as you realize, "I never existed!"

Ta-da!

(Of course by "you" here I mean the ego, not the Absolute. The Absolute is eternal.)

item.title: Spiral dynamics model breaks down under emotional mastery
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@How to be wise A stage Red or Blue person cannot have full emotional mastery because they are fundamentally deluded by ego at that stage. They can have a peak mystical experience, but they will not have full emotional mastery because that is a stage far beyond even enlightenment. That requires unimaginable degrees of consciousness which a stage Red or Blue person could not muster. The whole point of being at Red/Blue is that you are resisting full emotional mastery. If you got it, you'd transcend Red/Blue. At least at this day and age.

2000 years ago might have been a bit different because culture was so underdeveloped.

item.title: Real Spiritual Value of Marijuana
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, John Lula said:

@Leo Gura But Leo. Have you even tried smoking thyself completely stoned, and then contemplated?

No, I do not consume addictive substances.

If psychedelics were addictive, I would not use them.

item.title: Why be vegetarian?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Indeed, you can eat people. Go for it.

The reason you don't is because it is like shooting yourself in the foot, because identify with being human.

Likewise, as your ego dissolves, you will start to identify with the entire universe, including animals, and you will have more compassion, so you will probably not want to participate in factory farming.

At a high level of consciousness you will realize that swatting a fly is killing yourself.

And you will also realize that there cannot be life without death.

item.title: Is there any reason for a Turquoise to be Vegan?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Mafortu Arguments and reasons are a stage Orange paradigm.

Turquoise does not act to be good from reason. Goodness is inherent to Turquoise consciousness. There is no reason to be good. You be good simply because you want to. For no reason!

Or be a selfish prick. Either one is good. Whatver turns you on.

To be truly good is to realize there is no difference between good and bad.

When your ego dissolves you will start to identify more with everything, including animals, and you will probably not want to play a part in factory farming, etc. But you also won't make a big self-righteous stink about it because you will realize there cannot be life without death.

item.title: Why be vegetarian?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@isabel By that logic, why not eat people?

item.title: Real Spiritual Value of Marijuana
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Whatever juicy insights you think you get on weed will be 100x deeper on LSD. So that's really LSD's selling point.

LSD is the second most beautiful substance (after 5-MeO).

item.title: embodying the psychedelic experience
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Journaling, contemplation, and visualization should help a lot with this.

You could use just these 3 techniques + psychedelics to totally transform yourself within a couple of years. But you must do them consistently.

And Kriya yoga too! Kriya is excellent for raising your baseline level of consciousness to almost mild psychedelic levels.

item.title: Harvard does teach holism
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
1 hour ago, sarapr said:

How can you even say if someone is awekend? Enlightened people don't bare any marks on their forehead saying I'm enlightened, do they

Those who hang around on this forum masturbating about awakening cannot tell. On the other hand, those who awaken can clearly tell who is awakened and who isn't.

If you are confused about awakening, that's because you haven't awoken.

item.title: Relationship between Enlightenment and self Development
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Enlightenment is waking up to the fact that all of this is a dream. Development is about fashioning this dream to be the best that it can be.

Even once you awaken, the dream will still continue and you will have to do something. Even doing nothing is doing something.

item.title: Shamanic / Holotropic Breathing Mega-Thread
item.description:

However I've got to be honest here, it could be placebo so far

Your whole existence is a placebo

item.title: Problem with "Life Is A Dream"
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

It shows naivate to take analogies too literally.

All analogies break down when you push them far enough. The point of the analogy was to help you see you are asleep, not to get you to start fantasizing about flying through walls, etc.

Wake up first, then you can worry about the issue of control, if it still exists.

item.title: Harvard does teach holism

in Self-Actualization
8 minutes ago, Zweistein said:

Could it possibly be true though that scientists, who already lean towards green, would be able to self-actualize a bit quicker (if they are open-minded enough), than people who are "a bit stuck" at stage blue & orange? 🙈

Of course

Scientists will make great self-actualizers if they are just introduced to self-actualization work and if they can keep an open mind without getting stuck in rationalism or materialism.

item.title: What impels Ego to commit sins, constrained as it were by force?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

There is no such thing as evil. Evil is the projection of YOUR ego.

To you evil appears to exist because you think it is important that you survive. If you surrender your attachment to survival, all evil in the world will disappear at that precise moment.

Amazon means you can get nonduality books in 2 days, which is awesome!

Leo cannot lose because Leo is Jeff Bezos and everything else.

item.title: Enlightened Beings & Psychedelics
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Yes, they will experience hallucinations. Their perceptual system will get scrambled but their sense of oneness will be unfazed (if they are deeply enlightened).

I know an enlightened master who took 1000ug of LSD. He could no longer distinguish if it was night or day. But he was still grounded in Nothingness.

item.title: Can following intuition go wrong?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Butters Yes you can.

Intuition alone is not enough. What's required is consciousness, intelligence, self-reflection, broad study, shadow work, emotional mastery, and openess to feedback.

Without all of those, I can almost guarantee you will go wrong.

in Self-Actualization

Both!

item.title: Buying a house. Should you do it?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

This is the dumbest logic I've ever heard. By this logic, you shouldn't own anything because everything is made by someone else to make money.

Homes are a far safer investment than commercial real estate.

item.title: Mooji - Forget about Enlightenment
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@11modal11 No, no, no! You're misunderstanding enlightenment.

item.title: Concepts and enlightenment
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 hours ago, How to be wise said:

@Leo Gura does that mean that stage yellow is moving us away from enlightenment, because it is full of concepts. Stage yellow is more conceptual than stage green, so does that mean it’s harder to become enlightened as a stage yellow guy than a stage green guy?

No. Like I said, certain kinds of concepts are very useful for avoiding traps. Green falls into many spiritual traps.

Yellow is in a better position to pursue enlightenment than Green. Green is still way too tribal and Tier 1.

You can pursue enlightenment at any stage.

item.title: what if ...?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, sarapr said:

@Leo Gura  So that thing that creates the thoughts in our head is the thing present in a person with no sensory input but can't be felt. 

So in that case if you can't actually experience the thing creating the thoughts then what would make you so sure it's not the brain cause you can't feel the brain either. that's where I'm having a problem with your notion of brains don't exist. 

There is no thing that creates thoughts. Thoughts arise within emptiness. Everything arises within emptiness.

You cannot "experience" emptiness with the senses. But you can be conscious of it. Because it is consciousness. Emptiness is self-aware. That's what existence is.

item.title: does shadow work come before life purpose?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Well, if you don't want an LP, then why you taking the course?

That's like enrolling in a business class and saying, "But I don't want to run a business."

Don't do things just because I tell you. You must be intrinsically motivated to do them.

Follow your passion. Not my words.

It's not possible to explain. You must experience it.

item.title: Having a healthy ego, is that even a thing?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

A healthy ego is something like you see in Barack Obama. An unhealthy ego something like you see in Donald Trump.

An unhelathy ego is very insecure, clingy, greedy, closed, manipulative, dishonest, and well... self-centered. A healthy ego is the opposite.

Braden's work is a great way to move from unhealthy to healthy ego.

But it will not lead to ego-transcendence. That requires deeper teachings.

item.title: Brainwave Frequency Most Associated With Meditation?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Alpha, although the deepest meditation for purposes of nonduality is not measured by a single wavelength but a phase sync of alpha and theta. You won't find an audio to do that one. You have to train your mind to sync the peaks of alpha and theta, which requires an EEG machine, which is too complicated to go into here.

Theta beats are good for purifying trauma and shadow work.

item.title: Question about biocentricism
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Firstly, the universe does not exist inside a brain. The notion of "the brain" is itself part of the notion "the universe"! So the universe cannot exist inside a brain because that would be like saying the universe exists inside the universe, which is just silly.

The universe exists as a hallucination, nowhere! Not in any brain. Reality occurs nowhere, nowhen. Reality is an impossible object.

Secondly, the past is a concept. There is no such thing as the past. There is only the eternal present which the ego-mind misinterprets as past and future because it is deluded. Everything in reality has already occurred, simultaneously.

Thirdly, with your talk about McDonalds, you are speaking about the relative domain, which is the domain of Maya, the domain inside the dream. Inside the dream you must play by the dream's rules. In this dream, the rules are: if you eat McDonalds (which is an illusion), your body (which is an illusion) will deteriorate (which is an illusion) and you will die (which is an illusion).

When the only reality is illusion, illusions feel very "real" because you have no other point of reference.

Your death feels like a very serious event precisely because your life is an illusion!

Ta-da!

item.title: No time/energy to do self actualizing work?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Psyche_92 Yes, this is a huge problem.

What plan could you make to restructure your life so that you have significantly more time for self-actualization work?

This will probably involve making some radical structural changes, like re-thinking your entire career. This will involve some tough choices. And that is precisely how growth happens: tough choices, strategy, and emotional labor. You must be strategic and position yourself long-term so that you have more free time. If that means you spend 2 years re-training yourself for a new job, for example, then that's what you must do.

When I was in your shoes, I decided to quit my career and start my own business just so that I had the free time and money to do what I needed to do. It took me a 3-4 year detour to get my first business stabilized before I could really dig into my life purpose.

Working 10 hours per day simply will not work. It's a terrible strategy that you must now figure a way out of. Not only does it preclude self-actualization work, it will destroy your health and well-being in the long-term.

Work smarter, not harder.

After years of strategically laying my groundwork I now have the freedom to not work for 10 years without any financial problems. That's what good strategy will yield. I could retire and go meditate for 1 year straight without any worries, come back, and still be richer than when I left. This situation did not happen by accident! I deliberately designed it this way because I realized a long time ago that freedom was the #1 variable to living the kind of life I envision. It's very hard to self-actualize when you are a wage slave.

See video: How To Be A Strategic Motherfucker. I'm real serious about it.

item.title: Would Be Grateful for Help with Stage Yellow Confusion
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@TreeJeff You basically got it right.

The realities of real-world politics and government are extremely complex, messy, and difficult. When you go to apply Spiral Dynamics in the US political system, for example, all hell will break loose. All your lofty Yellow ideals will the tarred and feathered. You will be called a pedophile, a charlatan, and worse. And even if you succeed in getting elected President or Senator, or whatever, since you are not an absolute monarch, your power to change policy will be extremely limited because you have to work with all the other parties in power, who will not be at Yellow, and will look at you like a leper.

It doesn't matter what color stage you are at, or even if you are totally enlightened like the Buddha himself, if you were President of the US you would have to make incredibly painful choices that would involve the deaths of hundreds or even thousands of people REGARDLESS of your choice! This would be true even for a fully enlightened Turquoise leader! This is the part about governance that laypeople do not understand: simply because of the scale of a country like the US -- 330 million people -- most decisions will result in deaths of tens, hundreds, or thousands. Just by deciding to remove regulations on car pollution, you will kill people. Just by deciding to fund an infrastructure program, you will kill people. And so on.

A Yellow leader understands all this. So does a Turquoise leader. Yellow and Turquoise leaders are mature enough to understand that their actions will result in many deaths, which is why they would take their job very seriously and work very hard to make the best decisions possible. They would also know that their decisions could save tens of thousands of lives relative to a Tier 1 leader.

Being Yellow, Turquoise, or enlightened does not mean you will be a flawless leader whose policies please everyone and hurt no one. People will get killed and hurt under the watch. They will even get killed and hurt by your highest ideals and most noble policy changes.

Those are the harsh reality of governance. Which is precisely why we need highly conscious leaders in power, not people like Trump, who's actions will result in harm to millions as he approaches policy in an ignorant, simple-minded, and narcissistic manner.

And BTW, the people will also hate you because they are at Blue, Orange, and Green, and you as Yellow will not satisfy their bloodthirsty tribal desires to attack the enemy color. So as Yellow, even if you succeed, at least 1/3rd of the country will think of you as a traitorous devil.

Still want to be leader?

item.title: Religion and fully enlightened people?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

I have warned you guys against idealized notions of enlightenment many times. You are setting yourselves up for disappointment and some rude awakenings with all this "true enlightenment is perfect" stuff.

Don't be surprised when you see your "truely enlightened" guru pissing in your soup.
